articles.author: Tatiana Schlossberg and Tryggvi Adalbjornsson
articles.title: One Thing You Can Do: Make Your New Year’s Resolutions Count
articles.description: Also this week, holiday fireworks in Iceland and beyond
articles.content:
REYKJAVIK, Iceland Fireworks are a spectacular way to celebrate the new year, but they can also give you an environmental hangover: a cloud of nasty pollution that can stick around for hours. 
Thats a problem here in Reykjavik, Icelands capital city.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Federal Judge Temporarily Exempts Truck Drivers From California Gig Worker Law
articles.description: A federal judge has temporarily blocked a California labor law meant to take effect from Jan. 1 from impacting over 70,000 independent truckers by granting a 'temporary restraining order.'
articles.content:
(Reuters) - A federal judge has temporarily blocked a California labor law meant to take effect from Jan. 1 from impacting over 70,000 independent truckers by granting a 'temporary restraining order.'

articles.title: India Cold Wave Breaks Records, Shuts Schools and Makes Bad Air Worse
articles.description: Across the north, including New Delhi, plunging temperatures have caused a run on shelters in a region more used to extreme heat.
articles.content: In New Delhi and neighboring states, slowing winds have made air pollution worse, Indias meteorological department said. In the early hours of New Years Day, pollution levels in the capital soared to levels more than 20 times what the World Health Organizatio… [+588 chars]

articles.author: Richard Goldstein
articles.title: Don Larsen, Yankee Who Pitched Only Perfect Game in World Series, Dies at 90
articles.description: When Larsen took the mound against the Brooklyn Dodgers on the afternoon of Oct. 8, 1956, he was in the fourth season of an unremarkable career.
articles.content:
Don Larsen, an otherwise ordinary pitcher who achieved the extraordinary when he threw the only perfect game in World Series history, died on Wednesday in Hayden Lake, Idaho. He was 90.
His death was confirmed by Andrew Levy, his agent.
Larsens son, Scott, … [+346 chars]

articles.title: In Rose Bowl Victory Over Wisconsin, Oregon Shows Rebuild Around Trenches
articles.description: These Ducks would rather win with power than high-flying speed.
articles.content:

articles.title: Five Missing After Crab Fishing Boat Sinks Off Alaska
articles.description: Two of seven crew members were rescued after the Scandies Rose, a 130-foot-long crab fishing vessel, sank on Tuesday night, the Coast Guard said.
articles.content:
Coast Guard rescuers were searching for five people after the boat they were on sank off Alaska, officials said on Wednesday.
